itemDescription: British politician, journalist, philanthropist and businessman (born 1946)

wikipedia_page.main: John Dudley Fishburn (born 8 June 1946) is a British businessman, journalist, and politician. He was Executive Editor of The Economist and Member of Parliament of the United Kingdom (MP) for Kensington.

link_mentions.page: List of MPs elected in the 1992 United Kingdom general election

response: Boles's sister, Victoria Boles, married  Dudley Fishburn, a former member of Parliament.
The by-election following Rhys-Williams' death, from leukaemia, at the age of sixty, necessitated a by-election in which Kensington was held for the Conservatives by Dudley Fishburn.

The Kensington by-election, in Kensington, on 14 July 1988 was held after the death of Conservative Member of Parliament (MP) Brandon Rhys-Williams. Normally a relatively safe Conservative seat, it was narrowly won by Dudley Fishburn, who would retain the seat in 1992.
*Dudley Fishburn was a former editor of The Economist.Dudley Fishburn

On 23 May 2005, the Gibraltar-registered company Group Menatep Limited issued in London a press release announcing that former EU Commissioner Frits Bolkestein had joined the Advisory Board of Group Menatep. Before starting his political career, Bolkestein worked for Royal Dutch Shell oil company for 16 years.Frits Bolkestein en Menatep , hetknp.org, 30 May 2005] Fellow members of the Advisory Board were former US Deputy Secretary of the Treasury Stuart Eizenstat, former Executive Editor of The Economist Dudley Fishburn, former German Federal Minister of Economics Otto Graf Lambsdorff and Margery Kraus, founder and CEO of APCO Worldwide.Bolkestein, Chodorkovski, Yukos, Menatep en Clearstream , dewaarheid.nu
* Dudley Fishburn (born 1946), business man with strong links to the not-for-profit world
